title: Contour Plowing in the Palouse
description: The next time you fly over southeastern Washington, look down. The expanse of undulating hills covering the landscape is one of the more beautiful—and geologically distinctive—in the United States. In comparison to the long, linear ridges in many areas, the hills in the Palouse are arranged in a complex web of interlacing humps and hollows that look almost randomly placed.
theme:
FALSE – COLOR. Satellites show what human
eyes can't see
